30#ifdef min

33template<class T>
34inline T max(T a, T b)
35{
36 return a > b ? a : b;
37}
38template<class T>
39inline T max(T a, T b, T c)
40{
41 return max(max(a, b), c);
42}
43template<class T>
44inline T min(T a, T b)
45{
46 return a < b ? a : b;
47}
48template<class T>
49inline T min(T a, T b, T c)
50{
51 return min(min(a, b), c);
52}

54#ifdef __GNUC__
55 #define BITSCAN(mask) (__builtin_ffs(mask)-1)
56#else
57 #ifdef WIN32
58 #pragma intrinsic(_BitScanForward)
59 inline int BITSCAN(uint mask)
60 {
61 ulong i;
62 return _BitScanForward(&i, mask) ? i : -1;
63 }
64 #else
65 inline int BITSCAN(uint mask)
66 {
67 if(!mask) return -1;
68 int i = 1;
69 if(!(mask&0xFFFF)) { i += 16; mask >>= 16; }
70 if(!(mask&0xFF)) { i += 8; mask >>= 8; }
71 if(!(mask&0xF)) { i += 4; mask >>= 4; }
72 if(!(mask&3)) { i += 2; mask >>= 2; }
73 return i - (mask&1);
74 }
75 #endif
76#endif

78inline int randomint(int x)
79{
80 return rand()%(x);
81}
82inline float randomfloat(int x)
83{
84 return (float((rand()*float(x))/float(RAND_MAX)));
85}
86//1103515245+12345 are magic constants for LCG psuedorandom generator
87inline float detrnd(uint s, int x)
88{
89 return static_cast<int>(((s*1103515245+12345)>>16)%x);
90}

135inline void vformatstring(char *d, const char *fmt, va_list v, int len) { _vsnprintf(d, len, fmt, v); d[len-1] = 0; }
136
137template<size_t N>
138inline void vformatstring(char (&d)[N], const char *fmt, va_list v) { vformatstring(d, fmt, v, N); }
139
140inline char *copystring(char *d, const char *s, size_t len)
141{
142 size_t slen = min(strlen(s), len-1);
143 std::memcpy(d, s, slen);
144 d[slen] = 0;
145 return d;
146}
147template<size_t N>
148inline char *copystring(char (&d)[N], const char *s) { return copystring(d, s, N); }
149
150inline char *concatstring(char *d, const char *s, size_t len) { size_t used = strlen(d); return used < len ? copystring(d+used, s, len-used) : d; }
151
152template<size_t N>
153inline char *concatstring(char (&d)[N], const char *s) { return concatstring(d, s, N); }

155inline void nformatstring(char *d, int len, const char *fmt, ...) PRINTFARGS(3, 4);
156inline void nformatstring(char *d, int len, const char *fmt, ...)
157{
158 va_list v;
159 va_start(v, fmt);
160 vformatstring(d, fmt, v, len);
161 va_end(v);
162}

165inline void formatstring(char (&d)[N], const char *fmt, ...) PRINTFARGS(2, 3);

167template<size_t N>
168inline void formatstring(char (&d)[N], const char *fmt, ...)
169{
170 va_list v;
171 va_start(v, fmt);
172 vformatstring(d, fmt, v, static_cast<int>(N));
173 va_end(v);
174}

177inline void concformatstring(char (&d)[N], const char *fmt, ...) PRINTFARGS(2, 3);

179template<size_t N>
180inline void concformatstring(char (&d)[N], const char *fmt, ...)
181{
182 va_list v;
183 va_start(v, fmt);
184 int len = strlen(d);
185 vformatstring(d + len, fmt, v, static_cast<int>(N) - len);
186 va_end(v);
187}

194template<size_t N>
195inline bool matchstring(const char *s, size_t len, const char (&d)[N])
196{
197 return len == N-1 && !std::memcmp(s, d, N-1);
198}

200inline char *newstring(size_t l)
201{
202 return new char[l+1];
203}
204inline char *newstring(const char *s, size_t l)
205{
206 return copystring(newstring(l), s, l+1);
207}
208inline char *newstring(const char *s)
209{
210 size_t l = strlen(s);
211 char *d = newstring(l);
212 std::memcpy(d, s, l+1);
213 return d;
214}
215
216inline char *newconcatstring(const char *s, const char *t)
217{
218 size_t slen = strlen(s),
219 tlen = strlen(t);
220 char *r = newstring(slen + tlen);
221 std::memcpy(r, s, slen);
222 std::memcpy(&r[slen], t, tlen);
223 r[slen+tlen] = '\0';
224 return r;
225}

227template <class T>
228struct databuf
229{
230 enum
231 {
232 OVERREAD = 1<<0,
233 OVERWROTE = 1<<1
234 };
235
236 T *buf;
237 int len, maxlen;
238 uchar flags;
239
240 databuf() : buf(nullptr), len(0), maxlen(0), flags(0) {}
241
242 template<class U>
243 databuf(T *buf, U maxlen) : buf(buf), len(0), maxlen((int)maxlen), flags(0) {}
244
245 void reset()
246 {
247 len = 0;
248 flags = 0;
249 }
250
251 void reset(T *buf_, int maxlen_)
252 {
253 reset();
254 buf = buf_;
255 maxlen = maxlen_;
256 }
257
258 const T &get()
259 {
260 static const T overreadval = 0;
261 if(len<maxlen)
262 {
263 return buf[len++];
264 }
265 flags |= OVERREAD;
266 return overreadval;
267 }
268
282 databuf subbuf(int sz)
283 {
284 sz = std::clamp(sz, 0, maxlen-len);
285 len += sz;
286 return databuf(&buf[len-sz], sz);
287 }
288
299 T *pad(int numvals)
300 {
301 T *vals = &buf[len];
302 len += min(numvals, maxlen-len);
303 return vals;
304 }
305
313 void put(const T &val)
314 {
315 if(len<maxlen)
316 {
317 buf[len++] = val;
318 }
319 else
320 {
321 flags |= OVERWROTE;
322 }
323 }
324
325 void put(const T *vals, int numvals)
326 {
327 if(maxlen - len < numvals)
328 {
329 numvals = maxlen - len;
330 flags |= OVERWROTE;
331 }
332 std::memcpy(&buf[len], (const void *)vals, numvals*sizeof(T));
333 len += numvals;
334 }
335
336 int get(T *vals, int numvals)
337 {
338 if(maxlen - len < numvals)
339 {
340 numvals = maxlen - len;
341 flags |= OVERREAD;
342 }
343 std::memcpy(vals, (void *)&buf[len], numvals*sizeof(T));
344 len += numvals;
345 return numvals;
346 }
347
348 void offset(int n)
349 {
350 n = min(n, maxlen);
351 buf += n;
352 maxlen -= n;
353 len = max(len-n, 0);
354 }
355
364 T *getbuf() const { return buf; }
365
372 bool empty() const { return len==0; }
373
382 int length() const { return len; }
383
393 int remaining() const { return maxlen-len; }
394
405 bool overread() const { return (flags&OVERREAD)!=0; }
406
416 bool overwrote() const { return (flags&OVERWROTE)!=0; }
417
418 bool check(int n) { return remaining() >= n; }
419
420 void forceoverread()
421 {
422 len = maxlen;
423 flags |= OVERREAD;
424 }
425};

428typedef databuf<uchar> ucharbuf;

433struct sortless
434{
435 template<class T>
436 bool operator()(const T &x, const T &y) const { return x < y; }
437
438 bool operator()(char *x, char *y) const { return strcmp(x, y) < 0; }
439
440 bool operator()(const char *x, const char *y) const { return strcmp(x, y) < 0; }
441};
442
443struct sortnameless
444{
445 template<class T>
446 bool operator()(const T &x, const T &y) const { return sortless()(x.name, y.name); }
447
448 template<class T>
449 bool operator()(T *x, T *y) const { return sortless()(x->name, y->name); }
450
451 template<class T>
452 bool operator()(const T *x, const T *y) const { return sortless()(x->name, y->name); }
453};

469template<class T, class F>
470inline void insertionsort(T *start, T *end, F fun)
471{
472 for(T *i = start+1; i < end; i++)
473 {
474 if(fun(*i, i[-1]))
475 {
476 T tmp = *i;
477 *i = i[-1];
478 T *j = i-1;
479 for(; j > start && fun(tmp, j[-1]); --j)
480 {
481 *j = j[-1];
482 }
483 *j = tmp;
484 }
485 }
486
487}
488
489template<class T, class F>
490inline void insertionsort(T *buf, int n, F fun)
491{
492 insertionsort(buf, buf+n, fun);
493}
494
495template<class T>
496inline void insertionsort(T *buf, int n)
497{
498 insertionsort(buf, buf+n, sortless());
499}
500
515template<class T, class F>
516inline void quicksort(T *start, T *end, F fun)
517{
518 while(end-start > 10)
519 {
520 T *mid = &start[(end-start)/2], *i = start+1,
521 *j = end-2,
522 pivot;
523 if(fun(*start, *mid)) /* start < mid */
524 {
525 if(fun(end[-1], *start))
526 {
527 pivot = *start;
528 *start = end[-1];
529 end[-1] = *mid;
530 } /* end < start < mid */
531 else if(fun(end[-1], *mid))
532 {
533 pivot = end[-1];
534 end[-1] = *mid;
535 } /* start <= end < mid */
536 else
537 {
538 pivot = *mid;
539 } /* start < mid <= end */
540 }
541 else if(fun(*start, end[-1]))
542 {
543 pivot = *start;
544 *start = *mid;
545 } /*mid <= start < end */
546 else if(fun(*mid, end[-1]))
547 {
548 pivot = end[-1];
549 end[-1] = *start;
550 *start = *mid;
551 } /* mid < end <= start */
552 else
553 {
554 pivot = *mid;
555 std::swap(*start, end[-1]);
556 } /* end <= mid <= start */
557 *mid = end[-2];
558 do
559 {
560 while(fun(*i, pivot))
561 {
562 if(++i >= j)
563 {
564 goto partitioned;
565 }
566 }
567 while(fun(pivot, *--j))
568 {
569 if(i >= j)
570 {
571 goto partitioned;
572 }
573 }
574 std::swap(*i, *j);
575 } while(++i < j);
576 partitioned:
577 end[-2] = *i;
578 *i = pivot;
579
580 if(i-start < end-(i+1))
581 {
582 quicksort(start, i, fun);
583 start = i+1;
584 }
585 else
586 {
587 quicksort(i+1, end, fun);
588 end = i;
589 }
590 }
591
592 insertionsort(start, end, fun);
593}
594
595template<class T, class F>
596inline void quicksort(T *buf, int n, F fun)
597{
598 quicksort(buf, buf+n, fun);
599}
600
601template<class T>
602inline void quicksort(T *buf, int n)
603{
604 quicksort(buf, buf+n, sortless());
605}
606
607inline uint hthash(const char *key)
608{
609 uint h = 5381;
610 for(int i = 0, k; (k = key[i]); i++)
611 {
612 h = ((h<<5)+h)^k; // bernstein k=33 xor
613 }
614 return h;
615}
616
617inline bool htcmp(const char *x, const char *y)
618{
619 return !strcmp(x, y);
620}

622struct stringslice
623{
624 const char *str;
625 int len;
626 stringslice() {}
627 stringslice(const char *str, int len) : str(str), len(len) {}
628 stringslice(const char *str, const char *end) : str(str), len(static_cast<int>(end-str)) {}
629
630 const char *end() const { return &str[len]; }
631};
632
633inline char *newstring(const stringslice &s) { return newstring(s.str, s.len); }
634inline const char *stringptr(const char *s) { return s; }
635inline const char *stringptr(const stringslice &s) { return s.str; }
636inline int stringlen(const char *s) { return static_cast<int>(strlen(s)); }
637inline int stringlen(const stringslice &s) { return s.len; }
638
639inline char *copystring(char *d, const stringslice &s, size_t len)
640{
641 size_t slen = min(size_t(s.len), len-1);
642 std::memcpy(d, s.str, slen);
643 d[slen] = 0;
644 return d;
645}
646
647template<size_t N>
648inline char *copystring(char (&d)[N], const stringslice &s) { return copystring(d, s, N); }
649
650inline uint memhash(const void *ptr, int len)
651{
652 const uchar *data = (const uchar *)ptr;
653 uint h = 5381;
654 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(len); ++i)
655 {
656 h = ((h<<5)+h)^data[i];
657 }
658 return h;
659}
660
661inline uint hthash(const stringslice &s) { return memhash(s.str, s.len); }
662
663inline bool htcmp(const stringslice &x, const char *y)
664{
665 return x.len == (int)strlen(y) && !std::memcmp(x.str, y, x.len);
666}
667
668inline uint hthash(int key)
669{
670 return key;
671}
672
673inline bool htcmp(int x, int y)
674{
675 return x==y;
676}
677
678inline uint hthash(GLuint key)
679{
680 return key;
681}
682
683inline bool htcmp(GLuint x, GLuint y)
684{
685 return x==y;

702template <class T>
703struct vector
704{
705 static const int MINSIZE = 8;
707 T *buf;
708 int alen,
709 ulen;
717 vector() : buf(nullptr), alen(0), ulen(0)
718 {
719 }
720
729 vector(const vector &v) : buf(nullptr), alen(0), ulen(0)
730 {
731 *this = v;
732 }
733
740 ~vector() { shrink(0); if(buf) delete[] (uchar *)buf; }
741
753 vector<T> &operator=(const vector<T> &v)
754 {
755 shrink(0);
756 if(v.length() > alen)
757 {
758 growbuf(v.length());
759 }
760 for(int i = 0; i < v.length(); i++)
761 {
762 add(v[i]);
763 }
764 return *this;
765 }
766
786 T &add(const T &x)
787 {
788 if(ulen==alen)
789 {
790 growbuf(ulen+1);
791 }
792 new (&buf[ulen]) T(x);
793 return buf[ulen++];
794 }
795
812 T &add()
813 {
814 if(ulen==alen)
815 {
816 growbuf(ulen+1);
817 }
818 new (&buf[ulen]) T;
819 return buf[ulen++];
820 }
821
831 T &dup()
832 {
833 if(ulen==alen)
834 {
835 growbuf(ulen+1);
836 }
837 new (&buf[ulen]) T(buf[ulen-1]);
838 return buf[ulen++];
839 }
840
849 void move(vector<T> &v)
850 {
851 if(!ulen)
852 {
853 std::swap(buf, v.buf);
854 std::swap(ulen, v.ulen);
855 std::swap(alen, v.alen);
856 }
857 else
858 {
859 growbuf(ulen+v.ulen);
860 if(v.ulen)
861 {
862 std::memcpy(&buf[ulen], (void *)v.buf, v.ulen*sizeof(T));
863 }
864 ulen += v.ulen;
865 v.ulen = 0;
866 }
867 }
868
882 bool inrange(size_t i) const { return i<size_t(ulen); }
883
897 bool inrange(int i) const { return i>=0 && i<ulen; }
898
907 T &pop() { return buf[--ulen]; }
908
916 T &last() { return buf[ulen-1]; }
917
927 void drop() { ulen--; buf[ulen].~T(); }
928
940 bool empty() const { return ulen==0; }
941
953 int capacity() const { return alen; }
954
963 int length() const { return ulen; }
964
975 T &operator[](int i) { return buf[i]; }
976
987 const T &operator[](int i) const { return buf[i]; }
988
999 T *disown() { T *r = buf; buf = nullptr; alen = ulen = 0; return r; }
1000
1012 void shrink(int i)
1013 {
1014 if(!std::is_class<T>::value)
1015 {
1016 ulen = i;
1017 }
1018 else
1019 {
1020 while(ulen>i)
1021 {
1022 drop();
1023 }
1024 }
1025 }
1026
1033 void setsize(int i) { ulen = i; }
1034
1044 void deletecontents(int n = 0)
1045 {
1046 while(ulen > n)
1047 {
1048 delete pop();
1049 }
1050 }
1051
1061 void deletearrays(int n = 0)
1062 {
1063 while(ulen > n)
1064 {
1065 delete[] pop();
1066 }
1067 }

1078 T *getbuf() { return buf; }
1079
1089 const T *getbuf() const { return buf; }

1091 //now unused
1092
1093 /*
1094 * @brief returns whether the pointer is inside the vector's internal array
1095 *
1096 * Returns whether the pointer passed has an address that falls within
1097 * the used addresses of the vector. It will return false if the address is
1098 * only in the allocated buffer, or is not inside the address range at all.
1099 *
1100 * @param e the pointer to determine the status of
1101 *
1102 * @return true if the address is inside the vector's array
1103 * @return false if the address is outside the vector's array
1104 * /
1105 bool inbuf(const T *e) const { return e >= buf && e < &buf[ulen]; }
1106 */
1107
1119 template<class F>
1120 void sort(F fun, int i = 0, int n = -1)
1121 {
1122 quicksort(&buf[i], n < 0 ? ulen-i : n, fun);
1123 }
1124
1135 void sort() { sort(sortless()); }
1136
1149 void sortname() { sort(sortnameless()); }
1150
1160 void growbuf(int sz)
1161 {
1162 int olen = alen;
1163 if(alen <= 0)
1164 {
1165 alen = max(MINSIZE, sz);
1166 }
1167 else
1168 {
1169 while(alen < sz)
1170 {
1171 alen += alen/2;
1172 }
1173 }
1174 if(alen <= olen)
1175 {
1176 return;
1177 }
1178 uchar *newbuf = new uchar[alen*sizeof(T)];
1179 if(olen > 0)
1180 {
1181 if(ulen > 0)
1182 {
1183 std::memcpy(newbuf, (void *)buf, ulen*sizeof(T));
1184 }
1185 delete[] (uchar *)buf;
1186 }
1187 buf = (T *)newbuf;
1188 }
1189
1199 databuf<T> reserve(int sz)
1200 {
1201 if(alen-ulen < sz)
1202 {
1203 growbuf(ulen+sz);
1204 }
1205 return databuf<T>(&buf[ulen], sz);
1206 }
1207
1213 void advance(int sz)
1214 {
1215 ulen += sz;
1216 }
1217
1223 void addbuf(const databuf<T> &p)
1224 {
1225 advance(p.length());
1226 }
1227
1236 T *pad(int n)
1237 {
1238 T *buf = reserve(n).buf;
1239 advance(n);
1240 return buf;
1241 }
1242
1252 void put(const T &v) { add(v); }
1253
1260 void put(const T *v, int n)
1261 {
1262 databuf<T> buf = reserve(n);
1263 buf.put(v, n);
1264 addbuf(buf);
1265 }

1277 void remove(int i, int n)
1278 {
1279 for(int p = i+n; p<ulen; p++)
1280 {
1281 buf[p-n] = buf[p];
1282 }
1283 ulen -= n;
1284 }
1285
1301 T remove(int i)
1302 {
1303 T e = buf[i];
1304 for(int p = i+1; p<ulen; p++)
1305 {
1306 buf[p-1] = buf[p];
1307 }
1308 ulen--;
1309 return e;
1310 }
1311
1323 T removeunordered(int i)
1324 {
1325 T e = buf[i];
1326 ulen--;
1327 if(ulen>0)
1328 {
1329 buf[i] = buf[ulen];
1330 }
1331 return e;
1332 }
1333
1344 template<class U>
1345 int find(const U &o)
1346 {
1347 for(int i = 0; i < ulen; ++i)
1348 {
1349 if(buf[i]==o)
1350 {
1351 return i;
1352 }
1353 }
1354 return -1;
1355 }
1356
1366 void addunique(const T &o)
1367 {
1368 if(find(o) < 0)
1369 {
1370 add(o);
1371 }
1372 }
1373
1383 void removeobj(const T &o)
1384 {
1385 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(ulen); ++i)
1386 {
1387 if(buf[i] == o)
1388 {
1389 int dst = i;
1390 for(int j = i+1; j < ulen; j++)
1391 {
1392 if(!(buf[j] == o))
1393 {
1394 buf[dst++] = buf[j];
1395 }
1396 }
1397 setsize(dst);
1398 break;
1399 }
1400 }
1401 }
1402
1416 void replacewithlast(const T &o)
1417 {
1418 if(!ulen) //do not operate on empty vector
1419 {
1420 return;
1421 }
1422 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(ulen-1); ++i) //loop through
1423 {
1424 if(buf[i]==o) //compare to passed item
1425 {
1426 buf[i] = buf[ulen-1]; //move last element
1427 break;
1428 }
1429 ulen--; //move index down one
1430 }
1431 }
1432
1446 T &insert(int i, const T &e)
1447 {
1448 add(T()); //add to end of vector
1449 for(int p = ulen-1; p>i; p--) //from end to index, shift elements forwards one
1450 {
1451 buf[p] = buf[p-1];
1452 }
1453 buf[i] = e; //insert at ith location in buffer
1454 return buf[i]; //return the value assigned
1455 }
1456
1469 T *insert(int i, const T *e, int n)
1470 {
1471 if(alen-ulen < n) //expand buffer if needed
1472 {
1473 growbuf(ulen+n);
1474 }
1475 for(int j = 0; j < n; ++j) //add n elements to end
1476 {
1477 add(T());
1478 }
1479 for(int p = ulen-1; p>=i+n; p--) //for descending elements after i+n (new elements) move upwards by n
1480 {
1481 buf[p] = buf[p-n];
1482 }
1483 for(int j = 0; j < n; ++j) //set value of n elements to e
1484 {
1485 buf[i+j] = e[j];
1486 }
1487 return &buf[i]; //return first newly allocated
1488 }
1489
1496 void reverse()
1497 {
1498 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(ulen/2); ++i)
1499 {
1500 std::swap(buf[i], buf[ulen-1-i]);
1501 }
1502 }
1503
1512 static int heapparent(int i) { return (i - 1) >> 1; }
1513
1524 static int heapchild(int i) { return (i << 1) + 1; }
1525
1529 void buildheap()
1530 {
1531 for(int i = ulen/2; i >= 0; i--) downheap(i);
1532 }
1533
1544 int upheap(int i)
1545 {
1546 float score = heapscore(buf[i]);
1547 while(i > 0)
1548 {
1549 int pi = heapparent(i);
1550 if(score >= heapscore(buf[pi]))
1551 {
1552 break;
1553 }
1554 std::swap(buf[i], buf[pi]);
1555 i = pi;
1556 }
1557 return i;
1558 }
1559
1568 T &addheap(const T &x)
1569 {
1570 add(x);
1571 return buf[upheap(ulen-1)];
1572 }
1573
1583 int downheap(int i)
1584 {
1585 float score = heapscore(buf[i]);
1586 for(;;)
1587 {
1588 int ci = heapchild(i);
1589 if(ci >= ulen)
1590 {
1591 break;
1592 }
1593 float cscore = heapscore(buf[ci]);
1594 if(score > cscore)
1595 {
1596 if(ci+1 < ulen && heapscore(buf[ci+1]) < cscore)
1597 {
1598 std::swap(buf[ci+1], buf[i]); i = ci+1;
1599 }
1600 else
1601 {
1602 std::swap(buf[ci], buf[i]); i = ci;
1603 }
1604 }
1605 else if(ci+1 < ulen && heapscore(buf[ci+1]) < score)
1606 {
1607 std::swap(buf[ci+1], buf[i]); i = ci+1;
1608 }
1609 else break;
1610 }
1611 return i;
1612 }
1613
1622 T removeheap()
1623 {
1624 T e = removeunordered(0);
1625 if(ulen)
1626 {
1627 downheap(0);
1628 }
1629 return e;
1630 }
1631
1645 template<class K>
1646 int htfind(const K &key)
1647 {
1648 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(ulen); ++i)
1649 {
1650 if(htcmp(key, buf[i]))
1651 {
1652 return i;
1653 }
1654 }
1655 return -1;
1656 }
1657
1658 #define UNIQUE(overwrite, cleanup) \
1659 for(int i = 1; i < ulen; i++) \
1660 if(htcmp(buf[i-1], buf[i])) \
1661 { \
1662 int n = i; \
1663 while(++i < ulen) \
1664 { \
1665 if(!htcmp(buf[n-1], buf[i])) \
1666 { \
1667 overwrite; \
1668 n++; \
1669 } \
1670 } \
1671 cleanup; \
1672 break; \
1673 }
1674
1685 void unique() // contents must be initially sorted
1686 {
1687 UNIQUE(buf[n] = buf[i], setsize(n));
1688 }
1689
1697 void uniquedeletecontents()
1698 {
1699 UNIQUE(std::swap(buf[n], buf[i]), deletecontents(n));
1700 }
1701
1709 void uniquedeletearrays()
1710 {
1711 UNIQUE(std::swap(buf[n], buf[i]), deletearrays(n));
1712 }
1713 #undef UNIQUE
1714};
1715
1732template<class H, class E, class K, class T>
1733struct hashbase
1734{
1735 typedef E elemtype;
1736 typedef K keytype;
1737 typedef T datatype;
1738
1739 enum { CHUNKSIZE = 64 };
1740
1744 struct chain { E elem; chain *next; };
1745
1749 struct chainchunk { chain chains[CHUNKSIZE]; chainchunk *next; };
1750
1751 int size;
1752 int numelems;
1753 chain **chains;
1755 chainchunk *chunks;
1756 chain *unused;
1757
1758 enum { DEFAULTSIZE = 1<<10 }; //2^10 = 1024*(8) = 8192 bytes before allocation
1759
1760 hashbase(int size = DEFAULTSIZE)
1761 : size(size)
1762 {
1763 numelems = 0; //no elements assigned by default
1764 chunks = nullptr; //no chunks assigned
1765 unused = nullptr;
1766 chains = new chain *[size]; //the base array of chains: an array of 1024 pointers at default size
1767 memset(chains, 0, size*sizeof(chain *)); //clear all values inside the array to 0
1768 }
1769
1770 ~hashbase()
1771 {
1772 delete[] chains; //free the 1024 entry (by default) base array
1773 chains = nullptr;
1774 deletechunks();
1775 }
1776
1784 chain *insert(uint h)
1785 {
1786
1787 if(!unused)
1788 {
1789 chainchunk *chunk = new chainchunk;
1790 chunk->next = chunks;
1791 chunks = chunk;
1792 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(CHUNKSIZE-1); ++i)
1793 {
1794 chunk->chains[i].next = &chunk->chains[i+1];
1795 }
1796 chunk->chains[CHUNKSIZE-1].next = unused;
1797 unused = chunk->chains;
1798 }
1799 chain *c = unused;
1800 unused = unused->next;
1801 c->next = chains[h];
1802 chains[h] = c;
1803 numelems++;
1804 return c;
1805 }
1806
1807 template<class U>
1808 T &insert(uint h, const U &key)
1809 {
1810 chain *c = insert(h);
1811 H::setkey(c->elem, key);
1812 return H::getdata(c->elem);
1813 }
1814
1815 #define HTFIND(success, fail) \
1816 uint h = hthash(key)&(this->size-1); \
1817 for(chain *c = this->chains[h]; c; c = c->next) \
1818 { \
1819 if(htcmp(key, H::getkey(c->elem))) \
1820 { \
1821 return success H::getdata(c->elem); \
1822 } \
1823 } \
1824 return (fail);
1825
1826 template<class U>
1827 T *access(const U &key)
1828 {
1829 HTFIND(&, nullptr);
1830 }
1831
1832 template<class U, class V>
1833 T &access(const U &key, const V &elem)
1834 {
1835 HTFIND( , insert(h, key) = elem);
1836 }
1837
1838 template<class U>
1839 T &operator[](const U &key)
1840 {
1841 HTFIND( , insert(h, key));
1842 }
1843
1844 template<class U>
1845 T &find(const U &key, T &notfound)
1846 {
1847 HTFIND( , notfound);
1848 }
1849
1850 template<class U>
1851 const T &find(const U &key, const T &notfound)
1852 {
1853 HTFIND( , notfound);
1854 }
1855
1856 template<class U>
1857 bool remove(const U &key)
1858 {
1859 uint h = hthash(key)&(size-1);
1860 for(chain **p = &chains[h], *c = chains[h]; c; p = &c->next, c = c->next)
1861 {
1862 if(htcmp(key, H::getkey(c->elem)))
1863 {
1864 *p = c->next;
1865 c->elem.~E();
1866 new (&c->elem) E;
1867 c->next = unused;
1868 unused = c;
1869 numelems--;
1870 return true;
1871 }
1872 }
1873 return false;
1874 }
1875
1876 void recycle()
1877 {
1878 if(!numelems)
1879 {
1880 return;
1881 }
1882 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(size); ++i)
1883 {
1884 chain *c = chains[i];
1885 if(!c)
1886 {
1887 continue;
1888 }
1889 for(;;)
1890 {
1891 htrecycle(c->elem);
1892 if(!c->next)
1893 {
1894 break;
1895 }
1896 c = c->next;
1897 }
1898 c->next = unused;
1899 unused = chains[i];
1900 chains[i] = nullptr;
1901 }
1902 numelems = 0;
1903 }
1904
1905 void deletechunks()
1906 {
1907 for(chainchunk *nextchunk; chunks; chunks = nextchunk)
1908 {
1909 nextchunk = chunks->next;
1910 delete chunks;
1911 }
1912 }
1913
1914 void clear()
1915 {
1916 if(!numelems)
1917 {
1918 return;
1919 }
1920 memset(chains, 0, size*sizeof(chain *));
1921 numelems = 0;
1922 unused = nullptr;
1923 deletechunks();
1924 }
1925
1926 static inline chain *enumnext(void *i) { return ((chain *)i)->next; }
1927 static inline K &enumkey(void *i) { return H::getkey(((chain *)i)->elem); }
1928 static inline T &enumdata(void *i) { return H::getdata(((chain *)i)->elem); }
1929};
1930
1931template<class T>
1932inline void htrecycle(const T &) {}
1933
1934template<class T>
1935struct hashset : hashbase<hashset<T>, T, T, T>
1936{
1937 typedef hashbase<hashset<T>, T, T, T> basetype;
1938
1939 hashset(int size = basetype::DEFAULTSIZE) : basetype(size) {}
1940
1941 static inline const T &getkey(const T &elem) { return elem; }
1942 static inline T &getdata(T &elem) { return elem; }
1943 template<class K>
1944 static inline void setkey(T &, const K &) {}
1945
1946 template<class V>
1947 T &add(const V &elem)
1948 {
1949 return basetype::access(elem, elem);
1950 }
1951};
1952
1953template<class T>
1954struct hashnameset : hashbase<hashnameset<T>, T, const char *, T>
1955{
1956 typedef hashbase<hashnameset<T>, T, const char *, T> basetype;
1957
1958 hashnameset(int size = basetype::DEFAULTSIZE) : basetype(size) {}
1959
1960 template<class U>
1961 static inline const char *getkey(const U &elem) { return elem.name; }
1962
1963 template<class U>
1964 static inline const char *getkey(U *elem) { return elem->name; }
1965
1966 static inline T &getdata(T &elem) { return elem; }
1967
1968 template<class K>
1969 static inline void setkey(T &, const K &) {}
1970
1971 template<class V>
1972 T &add(const V &elem)
1973 {
1974 return basetype::access(getkey(elem), elem);
1975 }
1976};

1978template<class K, class T>
1979struct hashtableentry
1980{
1981 K key;
1982 T data;
1983};

1986inline void htrecycle(hashtableentry<K, T> &entry)
1987{
1988 htrecycle(entry.key);
1989 htrecycle(entry.data);

1992template<class K, class T>
1993struct hashtable : hashbase<hashtable<K, T>, hashtableentry<K, T>, K, T>
1994{
1995 typedef hashbase<hashtable<K, T>, hashtableentry<K, T>, K, T> basetype;
1996 typedef typename basetype::elemtype elemtype;
1997
1998 hashtable(int size = basetype::DEFAULTSIZE) : basetype(size) {}
1999
2000 static inline K &getkey(elemtype &elem) { return elem.key; }
2001 static inline T &getdata(elemtype &elem) { return elem.data; }
2002
2003 template<class U>
2004 static inline void setkey(elemtype &elem, const U &key) { elem.key = key; }
2005};
2006
2007//ht stands for a hash table
2008#define ENUMERATE_KT(ht,k,e,t,f,b) \
2009 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>((ht).size); ++i) \
2010 { \
2011 for(void *ec = (ht).chains[i]; ec;) \
2012 { \
2013 k &e = (ht).enumkey(ec); \
2014 t &f = (ht).enumdata(ec); \
2015 ec = (ht).enumnext(ec); \
2016 b; \
2017 } \
2018 }
2019#define ENUMERATE(ht,t,e,b) \
2020 for(int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>((ht).size); ++i) \
2021 { \
2022 for(void *ec = (ht).chains[i]; ec;) \
2023 { \
2024 t &e = (ht).enumdata(ec); \
2025 ec = (ht).enumnext(ec); \
2026 b; \
2027 } \
2028 }

2030template<class T>
2031inline T endianswap(T n) { union { T t; uint i; } conv; conv.t = n; conv.i = SDL_Swap32(conv.i); return conv.t; }
2032
2033template<>
2034inline uint endianswap<uint>(uint n) { return SDL_Swap32(n); }
2035
2036template<>
2037inline int endianswap<int>(int n) { return SDL_Swap32(n); }

2042#endif

2046
2047struct stream
2048{
2049#ifdef WIN32
2050 #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__MINGW32__)
2051 typedef off64_t offset;
2052 #else
2053 typedef __int64 offset;
2054 #endif
2055 #else
2056 typedef off_t offset;
2057#endif
2058 //see file/gz/utf8/zipstream children for more interesting forms
2059 virtual ~stream() {}
2060 virtual void close() = 0;
2061 virtual bool end() = 0;
2062 virtual offset tell() { return -1; }
2063 virtual offset rawtell() { return tell(); }
2064 virtual bool seek(offset, int) { return false; }
2065 virtual offset size();
2066 virtual offset rawsize() { return size(); }
2067 virtual size_t read(void *, size_t) { return 0; }
2068 virtual size_t write(const void *, size_t) { return 0; }
2069 virtual bool flush() { return true; }
2070 virtual int getchar() { uchar c; return read(&c, 1) == 1 ? c : -1; }
2071 virtual bool putchar(int n) { uchar c = n; return write(&c, 1) == 1; }
2072 virtual bool getline(char *str, size_t len);
2073 virtual bool putstring(const char *str) { size_t len = strlen(str); return write(str, len) == len; }
2074 virtual bool putline(const char *str) { return putstring(str) && putchar('\n'); }
2075 virtual size_t printf(const char *fmt, ...) PRINTFARGS(2, 3);
2076 virtual uint getcrc() { return 0; }
2077
2078 template<class T>
2079 size_t put(const T *v, size_t n) { return write(v, n*sizeof(T))/sizeof(T); }
2080
2081 template<class T>
2082 bool put(T n) { return write(&n, sizeof(n)) == sizeof(n); }
2083
2084 template<class T>
2085 size_t get(T *v, size_t n) { return read(v, n*sizeof(T))/sizeof(T); }
2086
2087 template<class T>
2088 T get() { T n; return read(&n, sizeof(n)) == sizeof(n) ? n : 0; }
2089
2090 template<class T>
2091 bool putbig(T n) { return put<T>(endianswap(n)); }
2092
2093
2094SDL_RWops *rwops();
2095
2096};

2120template<class T>
2121inline void putint_(T &p, int n)
2122{
2123 if(n<128 && n>-127)
2124 {
2125 p.put(n);
2126 }
2127 else if(n<0x8000 && n>=-0x8000)
2128 {
2129 p.put(0x80);
2130 p.put(n);
2131 p.put(n>>8);
2132 }
2133 else
2134 {
2135 p.put(0x81);
2136 p.put(n);
2137 p.put(n>>8);
2138 p.put(n>>16);
2139 p.put(n>>24);
2140 }
2141}
2142
2143template<class T>
2144inline void putuint_(T &p, int n)
2145{
2146 if(n < 0 || n >= (1<<21))
2147 {
2148 p.put(0x80 | (n & 0x7F));
2149 p.put(0x80 | ((n >> 7) & 0x7F));
2150 p.put(0x80 | ((n >> 14) & 0x7F));
2151 p.put(n >> 21);
2152 }
2153 else if(n < (1<<7))
2154 {
2155 p.put(n);
2156 }
2157 else if(n < (1<<14))
2158 {
2159 p.put(0x80 | (n & 0x7F));
2160 p.put(n >> 7);
2161 }
2162 else
2163 {
2164 p.put(0x80 | (n & 0x7F));
2165 p.put(0x80 | ((n >> 7) & 0x7F));
2166 p.put(n >> 14);
2167 }
2168}
2169

2171template<class T>
2172inline void sendstring_(const char *t, T &p)
2173{
2174 while(*t)
2175 {
2176 putint(p, *t++);
2177 }
2178 putint(p, 0);
2179}

2181template<class T>
2182inline void putfloat_(T &p, float f)
2183{
2184 p.put((uchar *)&f, sizeof(float));
2185}
